metadata.title: CVE-2020-11608 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.6.1.drivers/media/usb/gspca/ov519.c allows NULL pointer dereferences inov511_mode_init_regs and ov518_mode_init_regs when there are zeroendpoints, aka CID-998912346c0d.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-179-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-generic - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-179-lowlatency - 4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1067-aws - 4.4.0-1067.71
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-179.209~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1067.71').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~14.04.1').
